title: Fertilization
summary: Fertilization occurs when a sperm successfully penetrates an egg, forming a single-celled zygote that contains the full genetic blueprint for human development.
key_developments: Genetic material from both parents combines

title: Implantation
summary: The zygote divides repeatedly and implants itself into the uterine wall, beginning a more stable phase of development.

title: Body Axis Formation
summary: The embryo begins forming its basic body plan, establishing the head-to-tail and front-to-back axes.

title: Early Organ Development
summary: Major organs begin to take shape as the embryo rapidly grows and folds into a more recognizable form.

title: Rapid Brain Growth
summary: The brain grows rapidly, and facial features begin to form as development accelerates.
